item.title: Passionate About Machines, Prof. Explains Online Currency Bitcoin
item.description:
Passionate About Machines, Prof. Explains Online Currency Bitcoin

Cameron Pollack / Sun Photography Editor Ever since he was introduced to his father's 'adding machine,' Associate Professor Emin Sirer GÃ¼n Sirer, computer science, said he has been fascinated by the inner workings of computing machines and systems. "Every time I teach, there have been certain revelations about basic things that people have seen all their lives about how computers work that they took for granted, and they never really quite understood," Sirer said.

item.title: New Faster HOdlcoin CPU Miner is Now Available
item.description:
New Faster HOdlcoin CPU Miner is Now Available

There is a new HOdlcoin miner fork available that is optimized by Wolf0 ( source) that should increase your performance. We have compiled a Windows binary of the new miner for both 32-bit and 64-bit Windows and we are seeing performance improvement in both with the 64-bit release showing a bit better results.

item.title: Bitcoin Trading Platform ZeroBlock to Close - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Trading Platform ZeroBlock to Close - CoinDesk

Bitcoin trading platform ZeroBlock is closing down on Thursday, according to a notice posted to the service's website. A separate notice displayed to trading platform users advised revoking "any API keys from your exchange service", stating that the ZeroBlock database will be wiped after the shut down on 7th April.

item.title: Nvidia's New Pascal GPU Architecture With Tesla P100
item.description:
Nvidia's New Pascal GPU Architecture With Tesla P100

Today at the 2016 GPU Technology Conference in San Jose, Nvidia has announced their new Tesla P100 GPU for computing - the first one based on the next generation GPU architecture of the company that is coming to succeed the current Maxwell architecture.

item.title: Panama Papers, Mossack Fonseca, and Money Laundering with Bitcoin?
item.description:
Panama Papers, Mossack Fonseca, and Money Laundering with Bitcoin?

Is it possible to launder billions of USD with Bitcoin? For too long it has been said that cryptocurrencies abet money laundering, corruption, terrorism, and what not due to virtual currencies' transactions being anonymous and the lack of a central authority watching over the cryptocurrencies.

item.title: Bitcoin Could Consume as Much Energy as Denmark by 2020 - Breitbart
item.description:
Bitcoin Could Consume as Much Energy as Denmark by 2020 - Breitbart

Analysts are calling the cryptocurrency's current consumption of energy unsustainable and suggesting that if the currency is to survive, it will have to adopt new energy-efficient technology. Researcher Sebastiaan Deetman came to the conclusion that at bitcoin's current level of expansion, it will require 14 gigawatts of electricity to run by the year 2020 - an amount of energy equivalent to that of a small country, like Denmark.

item.title: Bitcoin Core Launches 'Sponsorship Programme' to Fund Development and More
item.description:
Bitcoin Core Launches 'Sponsorship Programme' to Fund Development and More

The Bitcoin Core development team launched a " Sponsorship Programme " on Monday that intends to provide an easy access point for the Bitcoin industry to support Bitcoin's long-time reference client with both funding and other types of contributions.

item.title: Bitcoin Exchange Coinmotion Announces Zero-Commission Trading Run
item.description:
Bitcoin Exchange Coinmotion Announces Zero-Commission Trading Run

European bitcoin exchange Coinmotion has announced a campaign which will see the exchange process orders with zero percent commission up to April 18. Finnish cryptocurrency exchange and wallet service provider Coinmotion has revealed a new campaign wherein customers will have to pay zero commission fee for orders processed.

item.title: Where did the idea of blockchain come from? Git was already used it since 2005
item.description:
Where did the idea of blockchain come from? Git was already used it since 2005

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. It's 100% free, no registration required. Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top guys, In blockchain, each block's hash is computed with the previous block's hash, that makes all blocks an immutable chain.
